alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 10:04AM CST until January 21 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. For the Duck River...including Centerville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River At Centerville. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flood waters will cover the flood plain along the river. Several roads near the river will be partially covered. In Centerville, Hickman Springs Road and Defeated Creek Road will be affected. Leatherwood Road between Shady Grove and Primm Springs near Tottys Bend will also be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 21.6 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet this evening. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 600 AM CST.
